result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Landry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 22 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign Releases.

No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J Landry in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  Attorney Rothstein recites some corrections to presentence investigation report.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rothstein makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

42 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 22 days)
  - 18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  - 24 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

BUY MONEY:  $640.00 to Metro Drug Unit (to be paid out of cash bail posted - remainder to be refunded to poster)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted - remainder to be refunded to poster)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Counts #1, 2 and 4-8 are dismissed and read-in.  State requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation and adjourns sentencing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
